title: The revival of the Rosebud bar, a historic artist hangout in Paris's Montparnasse neighborhood
summary: When it opened in 1962, the bar was a hangout for writers such as Marguerite Duras, Samuel Beckett, Jean-Paul Sartre and Simone de Beauvoir. It had lost some of its luster but is now being revived by a new generation of artists.

title: Vance says US wants 'lasting peace' after Zelensky meeting, criticizes Europe in combative speech
summary: The US vice president said he had a 'good conversation' with Ukraine's president after criticizing Europe's immigration policies and claiming free speech is 'in retreat' at the Munich Security Conference. Meanwhile, Zelensky says Trump is the key to ending the Russia-Ukraine conflict

title: OpenAI board unanimously rejects Elon Musk's $97.4 billion proposal
summary: OpenAI attorney William Savitt in a letter to Musk's attorney Friday, said the proposal 'not in the best interests of OAI's mission and is rejected.'

title: Ukraine offers one-year army contract for 18-24-year-olds
summary: This measure, criticized by volunteers, is part of the ongoing debates within the country about the need to strengthen the ranks of an already weakened Ukrainian army.

title: Donald Trump Jr finances the Enhanced Games, a proposed competition where doping is allowed
summary: Through the 1789 Capital fund, the eldest son of the US president will contribute several million dollars to this controversial event, the first of which could be held as early as the end of the year.

title: What is chocolate's carbon footprint?
summary: Deforestation is the leading source of carbon emissions from cocoa, much more than transportation or processing. But the impact varies significantly from country to country.

title: Jay-Z, Sean Combs accuser drops sexual assault lawsuit
summary: The billionaire and husband of Beyoncé, along with Combs, aka 'Diddy,' were accused of raping a 13-year-old girl back in 2000. Separately, Diddy has been charged with sex trafficking and racketeering, with federal prosecutors alleging that he sexually abused women and coerced them into drug-fueled sex parties using threats and violence, which he has denied.

title: JD Vance meets German far-right leader, says he fears free speech is 'in retreat'
summary: Vance, on Friday, met with Alice Weidel, the co-leader and candidate for chancellor of the far-right and anti-immigrant Alternative for Germany party. Mainstream German parties say they won't work with the party, a stance often referred to as a 'firewall.'

title: British government is doing everything it can not to upset Trump
summary: The Labour prime minister, Keir Starmer, reiterated his support for Ukraine without criticizing the American president's initiative. He also draws his domestic policy inspiration from the Republican.

title: United Arab Emirates break Arab front against Trump's Gaza plan
summary: The Emirati ambassador in Washington said he saw 'no alternative' to the plan announced by the US president to evict the Palestinian population from Gaza.

title: Trump flouts WTO rules with his reciprocal tariffs
summary: Countries applying tariffs to US products will be taxed at the same level, whereas, under World Trade Organization rules, developing countries benefit from differentiated rates. The executive order also targets the EU's value-added tax.

title: 'American platforms were supposed to kill French cinema. They are helping to save it'
summary: Netflix, Amazon and Disney are investing in French cinema, while France's moneymaker Canal+ is threatening to cut back its funding. What does the future hold for the film industry in France?, wonders Le Monde's Michel Guerrin in his column.

title: Americans in French ski resorts: 'For us, it's cheaper to come here'
summary: With rising resort prices in the US and a favorable exchange rate, more and more Americans are coming to Europe to enjoy the snow.

title: Ukraine accuses Russia of striking Chernobyl nuclear power plant
summary: In a social media post on Friday, Volodymyr Zelensky said that 'a Russian attack drone with a high-explosive warhead' hit a cover to contain radiation at the power. The Kremlin rejected that its army was targeting nuclear structures.

title: Pope Francis hospitalized with bronchitis
summary: The pope was admitted to hospital in Rome on Friday for tests. The 88-year-old has been breathless in recent days.

title: Apple targeted by French complaint over Siri recording private data
summary: A former employee of an Apple subcontractor accuses the company of not respecting its users' privacy.

title: Introducing M International: The best of Le Monde's M magazine, now in English
summary: From March on, the best of M Le magazine du Monde will be available online, in a biannual print edition and twice a month as a newsletter.

title: Spain's ex-football chief's trial over non-consensual kiss concludes
summary: Luis Rubiales awaits a verdict after his trial for kissing Jenni Hermoso at the 2023 Women's World Cup. Prosecutors are seeking two-and-a-half years in prison for Rubiales.
